component.description: After initial load of the web page the weather and map have little contact with the server. Any need of contact is mainly to the database and its to be able to retrieve information and then display it in an asynchronously manner to the webpage. Expanding on that point there are two types of markers, one for the points of interest of th city and another for the weather at the city at that time. When over the point of interest marker it displays a small window of information but once clicked it demonstrates a larger description of the location.
component.problems: Main diffculty within my individual part was the implementation of AJAX, as it is a more advanced topic within the web development spectrum. It required a lot of time, learning and mistakes to be able to accomplish what I required. This was complicated even more when having to deal with so many things, such as getting the data from database then converting it and then passing it to the AJAX function and finally adding the features within the website. Additionally, by making the website a single page application did not make it easier as typically you would want to load another page for other tasks/content, causing then think more meticulously on how to implement the features.
component.solutions:
To achieve the specification, basically not having to reload the page again after once loaded, AJAX was my main tool and friend as it would perform little calls to the server but it would still give the user the feeling that the page doesnt need to be loaded.
As mentioned AJAX was the main way to perfrom my individual part, that being through just vanilla javascript or using other libraries, such as jQuery to be able to help me (although I do acknowledge that using jQuery for AJAX is kind of an overkill and does have other features that could be more useful, nonetheless it was very helpful). AJAX was used to be able to display components from the database and to be able to change the weather markers on the map.
To be able to retrieve data from the database php was needed, this data was then formatted into XML as I believed it would be easy to manage and update (we did chnage the database a couple of times so this was handy as only few lines of code would need to be added or removed). A combination of AJAX, XML and google maps API was then used to be able display information within the maps. CSS also was very helpful as it provided styles to avoid having to reload the webpage but still giving a good experience.
